message: @brmore Thanks!
I'm one of the co-founders of Convore, if you have any questions, list 'em here.
I'll do my best to answer what I can :)
@ericflo you have a cute co-founder #geekcomment
how long does conversation persist? seems to me add-on (if not there) might be transcripts
@markjeffrey Rackspace Cloud
Suspected cloud :) makes sense.
db backend?  or did you go no-sql?
@brmore It stays around forever
oh, see ... now I want to watch multiple topics on same screen ... lots of ways to grow/add premium features.  you guys got some nice potential here, congrats!
Where you guys hosting this?  Cloud?  Or did you do your own co-lo?
Oh interesting :) wouldn't have guessed that -- but probably faster to get off the ground
@markjeffrey Definitely, and it gives us the ability to be flexible here while we're getting started.
if there, apologize, haven't banged around enough :-)
crap, see .. now I want threads.  this is going to be great.
guessing latter again ...
@markjeffrey PostgreSQL for now, but certain things will probably need to be moved to NoSQL eventually.
How much did it cost in dev roughly?
@garywkfung in both time and money.
@ericflo btw my question is how come you dropped threading/reply function?
has there been any thoughts of implementing Convore as an add-in to web browsers so that users can have the options to open Convore as a sidebar?

I've only been using this for 20 minutes and have noticed "extra clicks" in a few places (adding a group from search, for example).  I'm guessing things like this fall under the nice-to-have column of the TODO list, so my questions are:  Is there still just three of you?  At what point do you plan to grow the team to better accommodate the nice-to-have's?
